page.title: 16Economics (cont.)
page.content: The Junior Savers scheme,was intended to attract the customers of the future Mr.Jenkins felt that the role of the Halifax Building Society in Fleur-de-lys,was to provide services for the local people to save and to receive interest on their money and to lend money to enable them to buy their own homes,and repay the money over a long period.He told us that the building society was a uniquely British organisation,and was by law a non-profit making instition. Mr. Jenkins told us that his 5 staff dealt with 60 people daily plus a lot of others by telephone or by post.His insurance services covered buildings, contents,motor cars and peoples lives. The building society was also computerized. {______________________ {
